fields.description:
h3. Summary
Certain macros causes Page Properties Report macro pagination to break. 

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.9.10
* [Comala Workflows|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.comalatech.workflow/server/overview] v4.12.2
* [Page Information for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.adaptavist.confluence.pageinfo/server/overview] by Adaptavist, v3.2.8
* JIRA issue macro

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Download and install Third party plugin listed above
#* Or, connect Confluence to a JIRA instance
# Create a page and insert the *Page Properties Macro* in it
# Add simple table to include any of the macros listed above
#* Below is an example where we've included the macro *Page Status* (From the plugin Comala Workflows)
 !image-2016-05-24-02-47-31-041.png|thumbnail! 
# Save the page, and add a distinct label to this page, for example "decisions"
# Add 6 additional pages with the same content and label
# Add another page, insert the "Page Properties Report" Macro > Edit this macro > and add the label from step 4. Example, "decisions".
# Expand the "Options" setting and set the "Number of items to display" to 5
# Insert and Save the page
# The Page Properties Report macro will show 5 content in the first page as expected
# Click "Next" to go to the next page 

h3. Expected Results
The next page shows up 

h3. Actual Results
The next page is empty. If we click "Prev", all the contents in the first page will be missing as well
 !Capture.PNG!  


h3. Note
* Disabling the plugin resolves the pagination issue 
* Deleting the macros from the Page Properties macro
fields.summary: Certain Macro inside Page Properties Macro breaks Page Properties Report Macro Pagination
Wrong/misleading documentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
User belonging to a group with a different permission in a space inherits the permissions set for the group instead of the individual user.

A group has the 'Delete Own' permission, while an individual user does not. Individual user permissions should override the group permissions, even though the user belongs to the group. This means the user shouldn't be able to delete.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new space
# Navigate to Space Tools > Permissions > Edit permissions
# Grant the 'confluence-users' group and any individual user (e.g. 'test', in my case) the permissions as seen in Figure 1 (Refer to attachments)
# Log out and log in as the individual user (e.g. 'test', in my case)
# Create a new page in the earlier space
# Attempt to delete the page ({{...}} > Delete)

h3. Expected Results
User should not have the option to delete the page they created.

h3. Actual Results
User sees an option to delete the page and can successfully delete it.
fields.summary: Space permissions for individual user does not override permissions for groups for 'Delete Own'

fields.description:
The issue can be reproduced with Table Filter add-on.
There is a web-resource
 
{code:xml}
   <web-resource key="tf-editor-resources" name="Table Filter Editor Resources">
        <dependency>com.stiltsoft.confluence.plugin.tablefilter.tablefilter:web-resources</dependency>
        <transformation extension="js">
            <transformer key="jsI18n"/>
        </transformation>
        <context>editor</context>
        <resource type="download" name="tf-editor.css" location="css/tf-editor.css"/>
        <resource type="download" name="tablesorter.js" location="js/tablesorter.js"/>
        <resource type="download" name="tf-editor.js" location="js/tf-editor.js"/>
    </web-resource>
{code}
it depends on another resource
{code:xml}
    <web-resource key="web-resources" name="Web Resources">
        <dependency>com.atlassian.auiplugin:jquery-ui-other</dependency>
        <transformation extension="js">
            <transformer key="jsI18n"/>
        </transformation>
        <transformation extension="soy">
            <transformer key="soyTransformer">
                <functions>com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.soy:soy-core-functions</functions>
            </transformer>
        </transformation>
        <resource type="download" name="ie8_tf.js" location="js/ie8.js"/>
        <resource type="download" name="fixed-header-table.js" location="tf-libs/js/fixed-header-table.js"/>
        <!--etc.-->
        <dependency>confluence.web.resources:ajs</dependency>
        <context>com.stiltsoft.confluence.tablefilter-resources</context>
    </web-resource>
{code}

The doesn't reproduce if I remove 
{code:xml}
        <transformation extension="js">
            <transformer key="jsI18n"/>
        </transformation>
{code}
from the dependency.
fields.summary: StackOverflowError in page editor if an add-on's web-resource has a dependency with <transformer key="jsI18n>

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you use the "Find and Replace" feature on the page editor to search for a certain word, all formatting that was applied to the matched words will be gone. This issue is only seen in IE11 - not reproducible in Google Chrome and Firefox.

Refer to the .zip file for a video of the issue replication (video was too large and was over the maximum attachment limit).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page
# Copy the content of sourcecode.txt (Refer to attachment)
# Press CTRL+F to search for content within the page (while still in edit mode)
# Search for the word "old"
# Press enter as it goes over each word that matches

h3. Expected Results
All matching words will be highlighted and no changes will be made to the text.

h3. Actual Results
If the matched words are formatted, the formatting will be removed as the word is highlighted upon search.

h3. Environment
Windows 10 - Internet Explorer 11

h3. Workaround
Perform the search while viewing the page instead of while editing
fields.summary: 'Find' in page editor removes formatting on the searched word when using IE11

h3. Summary
The expand Macro UI is broken in IE 11

h3. Environment
* IE 11
* Confluence 5.9.10
* Confluence 5.9.4
* Confluence OnDemand Version 1000.95.0

h2. BUG 1: Body of the macro not available
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a Confluence page
# Insert the macro "Expand"
# Move cursor up or down outside the macro area

h3. Expected Results
Macro body will still be available

h3. Actual Results
Macro body no longer available
 
h3. Notes
This issue also observed when using mouse cursor to move out of the macro body

h3.Workaround
create a new line using the Return key

h2. BUG 2: Copied text is pasted outside body of macro
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a Confluence page
# Select some text and copy it
# Insert the macro "Expand"
# Paste the text using keyboard shortcut/right mouse click

Text is pasted inside the macro body

h3. Actual Results
Text is pasted outside the macro body

h3.Workaround
create a new line using the Return key

h2. Other Notes:
* Not observed in other browsers
* See attached video for more information
fields.summary: Expand Macro UI Broken in Internet Explorer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-42215].
  {panel}

I was marked as an admin on our instance a year ago. I don't even remember why. I think it was to delete a space or to view the stats.

A few days ago I stumbled upon a page in search. I had no idea this page was marked as restricted when I saw it. The authors noticed I viewed their secret page and reported me to upper management.

*My superiors made the arrangements for my dismissal in the event that my explanation would not be satisfactory.* I could have been fired even though I was completely unaware I did anything wrong. The private information my colleagues place on confluence is freely and openly available to our wiki admins. I trust my DBAs to not go snooping in the DB, they don't normally SELECT on the tables. But admins imagining they're just another user and freely searching through everything makes it too hard to avoid a breach of privacy. Breaking access restrictions needs to be deliberate and logged. I'd recommend:

* The definitions of each role need to be crystal clear. What they're allowed to do and not. Our wiki admin had no idea she granted me this much power.
* Whenever an admin is using their privilege to breach user privacy - there should be giant modal flashing red lights preventing that from accidentally happening.
* There should also be an admin action log dedicated to these privacy breaches. Or privilege escalations.

At the moment I'm going to recommend any organization with a high standard for secrecy or privacy to stay away from confluence. If you're already on confluence - make sure your admins have a separate admin account they never use unless they need to escalate their privileges.

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-1444
fields.summary: Make it harder for admins to breach expected privacy of users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41809].
  {panel}

I'd like an easy way to expand or collapse content in lists and by headings. Use cases include:
* Showing a high level summary of information to one audience without divorcing the summary from the details.
* More easily reviewing an outline of information while focusing on the key points.
* More easily navigating a page with an abundance of text.

For collapsing by headings, the Expando add-on exists, but it's not supported or available for Cloud.
https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.k15t.confluence.k15t-expando/server/overview

For lists, the built-in Expand Macro does not work with the built-in lists. It is essentially impossible to build a contiguous list while using Expand Macros for each item.

Suggestions:
Lists would either be collapsible by default or could be wrapped in a new macro that enables this functionality. 
The user should be able to expand a single item or all items at that level in the outline.
Page editor should be able to designate whether a list is collapsed or expanded by default when viewed.

For an example of potential implementation of collapsible lists or outlines, see OneNote.
https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Use-outlines-to-structure-notes-and-ideas-56373f1e-f55e-4356-8e87-32e650e5d832?ui=en-US&rs=en-US&ad=US#bm4

Are there any applicable workarounds available today?
fields.summary: Expand and collapse lists and headings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41748].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In Confluence Cloud, if default space permissions are not set to provide administrator permissions to a Confluence site administrator group or for some other reason admin access is lost, then site administrators must contact Atlassian Support to regain access as described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ConfCloud/Space+Permissions+Overview]:
bq.If you accidentally deny all admin access to a space so that nobody has access to administer the space any more, you can ask someone with Confluence Administrator global permission to Assign Space Permissions. In Confluence Cloud this means you'll need to create a support request.  

This is especially frustrating for administrators who must regain access to personal and global spaces from individuals who have left the organization.

h3. Suggested Solution
There are two possible solutions:
# Grant the ability to use the Confluence Administrator permission (as also mentioned in [CONF-31974|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-31974]
# Provide a new feature that will allow administrators to recover access to personal spaces.
fields.summary: In Confluence Cloud provide a way for space administrators to recover admin permissions to spaces

{{HibernateHiLoIdFixer#fixHiLoTable()}} is called after xml imports. This is being done as site import will replace any identifiers in the database, so the generator needs to be updated as well. Space and page imports in the other hand remap all identifiers to new identifiers using the generator so there is no need to reset the generator after those operations.

The reason for why the generator resetting can fail is that it might not see latest changes in the database during import.

The error messages caused by this bug can vary depending on the database used and depending on which entity happens to get a duplicate ID.
fields.summary: XML import can cause duplicate key errors

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41728].
  {panel}

When [granting access|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Page+Restrictions#PageRestrictions-Requestandgrantaccesstoviewarestrictedpage] for a user in a given child page, if restrictions apply in the page's parent that are overwriting the restriction settings of the child, the user won't be granted access to child page.

It would be best to make things clear to the user which pages they will have to request access to would make things more intuitive in terms of the path to access. 

For example, let them know that page is a child of another page, and he needs to ask for access in the parent page pages.

Another alternative (more difficult to be implemented) would be to include the parent page in the "request access" link, and that it should be as clear as possible that all of the requests will need to be granted for the bottom page to be reachable.
fields.summary: Improve the request access for restricted child pages email notification behavior

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Dragging an existing image and dropping it elsewhere on the page in IE11 results in a duplicate attachment

h3. Environment
* Tested on Confluence 5.8.13, 5.8.18, and 5.9.10
* Can reproduce using IE 11
* Can *NOT* repro with Chrome, Safari, or Firefox

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with an image on it
# Using IE11, click and drag the image, then release the click elsewhere on the page

h3. Expected Results
# Nothing

h3. Actual Results
# Image is duplicated, with a *[1]* added to the filename
# Subsequent attempts to drag and drop show the same behavior in the UI, but no additional images are created beyond the first copy (i.e. you end up with 2 duplicate images attached to the page)
# Thus, all users watching the page are notified of the new duplicate attachment, resulting in needless email 

h3.Workaround
Use Chrome, Safari, or Firefox instead
fields.summary: Dragging an existing image and dropping it elsewhere on the page in IE11 results in a duplicate attachment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41726].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Create a new issue with JIRA issue macro will fail if the *Component/s* field is set as required in JIRA.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project in JIRA and set the *Component/s* field as required(this component is not a custom one).
# Go to Confluence.
# Add a JIRA Issue Macro and edit it, or select some text and click the JIRA icon to create a ticket.
# Select "Create New Issue".
# Choose the project you recently created.
# Save it

h3. Expected Results
The issue will be created

h3. Actual Results
The issue is not created and a message is thrown saying that the *Component/s* is a required field.
If you use the 2nd option of highlighting the text, no error is shown. Instead, "getting required fields" will remain on the screen.

h3. Notes
Possibly a regression of this ticket: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-23424

h3.Workaround
Set the *Component/s* field as *optional*.
fields.summary: Can't create new JIRA issue in Confluence if Component/s is a required field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41723].
  {panel}

Hi there, with one small change I could basically use confluence as our document management system, dump SharePoint, and cement Confluence in our future forever! It would also remove a huge annoyance with using it. I promise, it at least sounds like a small change.

Please refer to the attached photos to help understand my suggestion:

*'before' image:*
* Shows the attachment macro widget. I've only one file listed.
* Problem 1 - when you have 78 versions of a file, you have to scroll all the way to the bottom to find the 'edit in office' button.
* Problem 2 - the average business user (not techie) won't find the 'edit in office' button and therefore simply download the file, rather than edit it.
* These problems prevent me from using confluence as a document management system outside of the tech groups. Don't worry, we won't store 1,000s of docs, but we do want to store some.

*'after' image*
* Move the buttons to where I've shown them i.e. in line with the document name.
* Make the buttons only display on hover i.e. you would only ever show one row of buttons at any time, to avoid visual noise.

I think this will help solve the problems I've outlined.
fields.summary: Move buttons to top of attachment macro
Inline comment username encoding issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary Creating an XML Backup using Oracle JDBC driver 12.1.0.2 doesn't properly export the Active Objects tables sequence definitions. h3. Environment * Confluence 5.9.9 * Oracle Database 12c Enterprise Edition Release 12.1.0.2.0 - 64bit Production h3. Steps to Reproduce # Download the Oracle JDBC driver 12.0.1.2 from [Oracle's website|http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/database/features/jdbc/index-091264.html] and place into /confluence/WEB-INF/lib/. # Connect Confluence to Oracle via direct JDBC as per [Database Setup for Oracle|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Database+Setup+for+Oracle] # Generate an XML backup via Confluence Admin > Backup & Restore. h3. Expected Results Sequence definitions for Active Object tables are exported. This can be inspected by extracting the XML Backup and browsing the {{plugin-data/com.atlassian.activeobjects.confluence.spi/activeObjectsBackupRestoreProvider.pdata}} file. Using the table {{AO_9412A1_AOUSER}} as an example, we would expect the {{autoIncrement}} attribute for the *ID column* definition (the primary key) set to *true*, as following: {code:xml|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
{code} h3. Actual Results The primary keys for the tables in the {{plugin-data/com.atlassian.activeobjects.confluence.spi/activeObjectsBackupRestoreProvider.pdata}} file have their {{autoIncrement}} attribute set to false. Using the previous example ({{AO_9412A1_AOUSER.ID}}) {code:xml|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
{code} *Business Impact* Importing this XML Backup into a new Confluence instance will corrupt the data and break several Confluence functionalities, including inline tasks and plugins that rely on Active Objects such as Team Calendars. Administrators can expect errors to be printed in Confluence logs which indicate that sequences are missing. The below snippet is an example following an XML import into a Postgres database: {noformat} 2016-03-31 13:40:14,740 ERROR [http-bio-8090-exec-91] [atlassian.event.internal.AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher] run There was an exception thrown trying to dispatch event [com.atlassian.mywork.host.event.BeforeCountNewNotificationsEvent@7b8de54f] from the invoker [SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker{method=public void com.atlassian.mywork.host.service.ClientServiceImpl.verifyAuth(com.atlassian.mywork.host.event.BeforeCountNewNotificationsEvent), listener=com.atlassian.mywork.host.service.ClientServiceImpl@1cbfb81d}] -- referer: http:/confluence.example.com/display/SPACE/Page+Name | url: /rest/mywork/latest/status/notification/count | userName: example_user java.lang.RuntimeException: There was a SQL exception thrown by the Active Objects library: Database: - name:PostgreSQL - version:9.3.10 - minor version:3 - major version:9 Driver: - name:PostgreSQL Native Driver - version:PostgreSQL 9.2 JDBC4 (build 1002) org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: relation "AO_9412A1_USER_APP_LINK_ID_seq" does not exist Position: 16 {noformat} h3. Notes This was reproducible on Confluence 5.9.9 but likely affects all prior versions supporting Oracle 12c (Confluence 5.7+) h3. Workaround 1 Modify the {{plugin-data/com.atlassian.activeobjects.confluence.spi/activeObjectsBackupRestoreProvider.pdata}} file such that the primary key of each AO table has autoIncrement set to "true". This will ensure that once imported, the correct sequences will be created for the primary keys. h3. Workaround 2 When generating an XML backup, temporarily revert to the Oracle JDBC 12.1.0.1 driver instead.
fields.summary: AO sequences are missing in XML Backups created using the Oracle JDBC driver 12.1.0.2

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41720].
  {panel}

Hi Atlassian-Team,

first of all, I realy like the new Dashboard with the sidebar and a lot of my customers do as well. Just to make it even a little better, I've got a few suggestions, that would help make the work of a Confluence user even more efficient:

h3. Updates
Actually, in larger systems nobody cares about all update or even hat the time to care about it. Even the popular content is most of the time not interesting for most people. If you'd like to work efficiently you realy need to customize your activity stream by yourself to just get the information you're interestet in. You can do so with watching or favoring content (spaces) People want to decide what they want to be informed about (PULL) and not getting PUSH-notified. Hence, *updates from my favorites > all updates* !

h3. Tasks
You already started to get important content for a user out of the profile onto the dasboard. That's great and I'd even get further by moving other personal work content like *Tasks* or *Drafts* to the *My Work* category at the dashboard / sidebar.

h3. Customize the dashboard
Last but not least, since more and more items will be needed on the dashboard. it would be realy helpful, if admins and users could customize the dashboard / side easily similar to the sidebar of space by hiding specific elements that they dont need.

I hope that will help you to keep on improving Confluence even more!
Cheers
Florian
fields.summary: Dashboard more user individual (e.g. updates from favorite spaces)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41712].
  {panel}

In Confluence, we can use the [Keyboard Shortcuts|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF57/Keyboard+Shortcuts] in order to work with the editor and other feature of the Application. However, when we use the [Confluence Preview|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ConfCloud/Display+Files+and+Images#DisplayFilesandImages-Previewafile] to take a look at attachments and images, we can only use the keyboard to move to the next/previous attachment and close the Previews. 

Having keyboard shortcuts for all of the commands available within the preview plugin would definitely help. Having said that, it would be important that the keyboard shortcuts are listed on-screen (for both sighted users as well as users using screen readers). Additionally, for any controls in the preview pane, it would be good to allow the user to tab through those controls as that is a fairly well used mechanic utilized with screen readers.

This is a suggestion to allow the users to also have keyboard shortcuts to access the other options of the Preview. For example:

# 'D' to Download the image file.
# 'U' Upload a new version of the file (attached files only).
# 'C' to Comment on the file.
# 'Z' for the Zoom, out or fit the image to the width of your browser.
# 'B' to Browse like a slideshow using the next and back buttons.
# 'S' Switch to a full screen presentation mode
fields.summary: Keyboard Shortcut for Confluence Previews

I'm working on a prototype of a table where each "logical" row has two very small pieces of information, and one big one.  The two small pieces are just a name and an email address.  The big piece is an embedded calendar.

I previously struggled with trying to have multiple cells in the first column, each with a header cell.  I am unable to make it look reasonable, so I decided to try merging the cells in that column, resulting in going back to a one-to-one relationship between logical rows and physical rows.

The "TwoLogicalRows" image is the image on the edit screen of my current prototype.

I then drag-selected the four cells directly below the "Lab Name" header and clicked "Merge table cells".

This produced a very unexpected and messed-up result, which is reflected by the "AfterMerging..." image.  I have no idea what to do with that. I just discarded the changes at that point.  I am still unable to produce the result that I'm looking for.  I imagine my workaround will be to delete almost everything and start over.
fields.summary: Merging table cells in column next to column where cells have been previously merged results in messed up display

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41697].
  {panel}

h4.Symptoms

While using the Confluence editor, one of the options that we have is to [insert tables|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF57/Working+with+Tables]. When using such content, if you try to manually add whitespaces in the table, it will be ignored depending on how you insert it. 

For example, in the following table, while editing Confluence, we can see the whitespaces before the numbers, in the first column: 

!table.png!

If you *save* the page, the whitespaces will be ignored. 

h4.Workaround

Type the number of whitespaces needed in another part of the page and then, manually *copy* and *paste* it inside the table. By doing it, Confluence will identify the pasted content as a character and it will not ignore, having it looking like the screenshot used above:

# Go to any page that you would like to have the whitespaces in the tables
# In a blank part of this page, type the number of spaces that you need to the table
# Copy the blank spaces used in a random part of the page
# Paste inside the table, in the location that you need.
# Save the page
fields.summary: Whitespaces Ignored for Tables

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41685].
  {panel}

We're using Confluence Cloud as well as Box as a cloud-based enterprise. An important use case is to embed Box widgets in Confluence pages.

The Widget Connector Macro should support Box embeds. Box has an API to obtain the embed URL, so this seems pretty simple to implement. Here's some documentation from Box for developers.

It seems the same issue was closed in 2014 as unresolved. https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-23203

Since Widget Connector doesn't work, we're using a painful manual workaround with Iframe Macro. The user has to manually set up the iframe, which is confusing for laymen. Basically, they need to find and copy the embed link and then paste it in an iframe macro, and at minimum define the width and height. Box instructions for embed widget.

Also, the Iframe Macro doesn't seem to support full screen. It should have a field or checkbox for "allowfullscreen". 

Please support Box.com with the Widget Connector! It is crucial for the workflow of any company using Box.com for file storage.
fields.summary: Widget connector support for Box.com

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41683].
  {panel}

Today is the first day I tried to post questions about Atlassian Confluence.  I apparently don't have 3 karma points yet, so my activities are limited.

I posted a question.  Someone posted an answer to it.  I tried to write a comment on that answer, but it seemed to hang trying to display the comment box, so I created a new question to ask the question I was trying to ask in the comment.  I later noticed that the comment box finally displayed, so I went back to it and added the information about the question I wanted to ask.  When I tried to post it, it said I couldn't do that until I had 3 karma points.

I then went to the second question I had posted.  Someone provided an answer to that, but I had to ask an additional question, so i tried to write a comment asking that question.  Guess what it said?  I then tried to post a new third question, and it just said "Not Permitted".

Do I have to go somewhere else to get questions answered about how to use Atlassian products?
fields.summary: Restricting my actions until I get 3 points shouldn't apply to writing comments to answers to my own question

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41682].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When listing attachments on a page in Confluence, there's an option to Download All attachments.

If a page has a particularly large number of attachments, this can cause Confluence to crash.

 !Screen Shot 2016-05-12 at 16.27.02.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide ability for administrators to disable the download option either for an entire instance, or some pages.
 
h3. Workaround 
In Server it is possible to [disable via code|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+disable+attachment+downloads] but this is not an option in Confluence Cloud.
fields.summary: As an admin, ability to disable Download All feature from attachments

fields.description:
Currently, when inserting a user macro, it is possible for the user to select BLOCK or INLINE.
 !image-2016-05-11-11-23-34-660.png|thumbnail! 

The need is to be able to define in the user macro a default behavior, for example, always display as BLOCK.
There is a Confluence question about it too:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/62467/can-i-set-a-default-value-for-a-user-macro-to-be-inline-or-block-in-the-template

We tried adding this parameter in the user macro:
## @param atlassian-macro-output-type:type=enum|enumValues=BLOCK,INLINE|default=BLOCK

But when using the macro, the default value is still INLINE.

Also, we noticed that when we set the parameter to BLOCK from the "Edit Macro" window, the display still remains INLINE.
 !image-2016-05-11-11-22-52-664.png|thumbnail! 

The only way to have Confluence apply the BLOCK display is to click the icon (on the first screenshot).
fields.summary: User macro display BLOCK/INLINE by default

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Group search selector (opengrouppicker.action) in space tools returns zero results on the second search of the same group name, when all groups from the previous search on the first page were selected.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.8.18+

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create more than 10 groups with a common name or letter sequence (e.g. 'group 1', 'group 2', ... 'group 16')
# Create a space and navigate to space permissions page
# Edit space permissions
# Click Search icon (magnifying glass) under Groups (to open opengrouppicker.action)
# Search for {{*group*}} where 'group' is the common letter sequence of all the groups you want to find
# Select all results from page 1 of the search
# Click add when taken back to permissions screen
# Click Search icon (magnifying glass) under Groups again
# Perform the same search for {{*group*}}
# No other group results are available to be added, info message *No groups were found matching your criteria*

h3. Expected Results
Search should return the remaining results on subsequent pages and allow you to add the groups to the space permissions page

h3. Actual Results
# No other group results are available to be added, info message *No groups were found matching your criteria*
# Performing a {{tail -f atlassian-confluence.log}} while reproducing yields no message of any sort
 
h3. Notes
* Reproducible in Chrome and Safari
* Screenshots attached for reference

h3.Workaround
* When you have a large number of groups (i.e. 100+) with a common letter sequence, they _may_ be selectable in the search screen by clicking on the page numbers at the bottom of the results page.
** However, when testing, I created 17 groups in one instance and 23 groups in another instance; there was no option to select page 2+.
** Separate tests using AD groups with over 10 pages of results allowed us to choose a page number at the bottom of the search results and add more groups to the space permissions.
* Separately, I found that if you create a brand new group after the first group selection, the subsequent pages in the search results can now be seen and selected.
fields.summary: Group search selector (opengrouppicker.action) in space tools yields no results in subsequent searches for similarly named groups

fields.description:
h3. Summary
{{CONFVERSION}} table is empty after full site import

h3. Environment
Bug reproduced on 5.5.6, 5.8.18, 5.9.4 and 5.9.7

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install a fresh instance of Confluence
# Configure it with an external database
# Once Confluence is up and running, run the following query on the database
{code}
select * from confversion;
{code}
# You should see the entry for the build number
# Import a full site XML Backup
# Once done, query the {{CONFVERSION}} table again

\\
h3. Expected Results
We should see the same build number entry

\\
h3. Actual Results
{{CONFVERSION}} table is empty now
 
\\
h3.Workaround
There is no workaround for the time being

fields.description:
h3. Description
When running Confluence with Japanese language and using the shortcut "W" shortcut key to watch/stop-watch a page/space, the text is always the same: 
English: You started watching this page.
Japanese: このページをウォッチしています。

English: You stopped watching this page.
Japanese: このページをウォッチしています。

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Set up Confluence with Japanese language.
# Watch a page using the "W" shortcut key.
# Stop watching a page using the "W" shortcut key.

h3. Expected Results
When watching a page:
このページをウォッチしています。

When stopping watching a page:
Something like "このページを見て停止しました"

h3. Actual Results
When watching a page:
このページをウォッチしています。

When stopping watching a page:
このページをウォッチしています。

h3. Workaround

If manually selecting the Watch button, a different message is shown up correctly.
fields.summary: Same Japanese message for either watching or unwatching page or space

fields.description:
The code responsible for parsing the excerpt XML when rendering a page is not consistent with the code that parses the XML to determine if the checkbox should be checked. XML:
{code}
  <ac:structured-macro ac:macro-id="PLACEHOLDER" ac:name="excerpt-include" ac:schema-version="1">
    <ac:parameter ac:name="nopanel">   true    </ac:parameter>
    <ac:parameter ac:name="">
      <ac:link>
        <ri:page ri:content-title="PLACEHOLDER" ri:space-key="PLACEHOLDER"/>
      </ac:link>
    </ac:parameter>
  </ac:structured-macro>
{code}

In this case the checkbox will be ticked for not showing the panel (see checkbox.png), but when the page is rendered, the border is still there (see bar.png).

But if the whitespace around true is removed, everything works correctly:
{code}
<ac:parameter ac:name="nopanel">true</ac:parameter>
{code}

It also breaks if there are new lines, i.e:
{code}
<ac:parameter ac:name="nopanel">
  true
</ac:parameter>
{code}

It would be nice if whitespace was ignored here(what the checkbox code seems to do), but as long as everything is consistent the bug could be considered fixed.
fields.summary: Excerpt Macro rendering does not parse XML correctly

fields.description:
It was discovered that often, after false eviction of cluster node (f.e. b/c of long running GC pause), node panics when hazelcast actually tries to join that problematic node back to cluster. We need to disable panic when node received MERGING event from the cluster.
Investigation needs to be done when we need to re-set MERGING flag and allow panic again (on MERGED / timeout / etc)

*NB: This has been superseded by CONF-42954.*
fields.summary: Data Centre - don't trigger cluster panic when node is merging

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Text color breaks sorting in Page Properties report macro

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.8.10

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a few pages with page properties macros with a 'test' label including timestamps of this format:
{{MM/DD/YYYY hh:mm:ss}} 
# For example, my page properties include a table with *Test name, Description, Start Time,* and *End Time*.
# Make the text of some of those tables something other than black. For example, I've tried red and light green in my test environment
# Create a page with a page properties report macro including the 'test' label. Set it to sort based on *Start Time*

h3. Expected Results
Macro sorts based on the timestamp. There is no difference between black text and any other color, as it should only sort based on text.

h3. Actual Results
Because of the differently colored text, the macro sorts the table text differently. See attached screenshots for reference.
 
h3.Workaround
No workaround found so far.
fields.summary: Text color breaks sorting in Page Properties report macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41640].
  {panel}

h4. Summary
Java 8 update 20 has introduced an additional flag for the G1 garbage collector that enables string deduplication to lower the memory footprint of the JVM. The functionality can be enabled by adding the {{-XX:+UseStringDeduplication}} JVM flag.

More information about this parameter can be found in the following links:
- [https://blogs.oracle.com/java-platform-group/entry/g1_from_garbage_collector_to]
- [http://java-performance.info/java-string-deduplication/]
- [https://blog.codecentric.de/en/2014/08/string-deduplication-new-feature-java-8-update-20-2/]

h4. Suggestion
Evaluate adding this parameter by default, as it is said not to cause significant performance overhead, however it can save additional heap memory, asynchronously to GC cycles.
fields.summary: Enable string deduplication by default
Confluence Label content page paging system is not working correctly

fields.description:
A user with enough rights to delete a page (along with all its attachments and all previous versions) can not delete just one version in the history.
Maybe there's a reason, but this looks like a bug.
A user who can delete a page should be able to delete a previous version of that page.

h3. Summary
Blog Posts don't follow the date format in general configuration

h3. Environment
Issue reproduced on 5.8.18, 5.9.7

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Blog Post
# Create a new Page
# Go to General Configuration
# Change the Date Format settings to "dd MMM, yyyy"
# Save and go back to the Space
# Check the Page details and check the Blog Post details

h3. Expected Results
Date format for both the Page and Blog Post should have changed the date format

h3. Actual Results
The date format changes for Page but NOT for the Blog Post
 

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround for the time being.
fields.summary: Blog Posts don't follow the date format in general configuration

fields.description:
If a page (without restrictions) has the same page name as a trashed page with restrictions, then that page shows up in the 'Restricted Pages' screen, even though the current active page has no restrictions.

Solution - do not show trashed pages in the 'Restricted Pages' screen.
